name: Baileys Delight
instructions: Heat milk in a saucepan along with cinnamon and cardamons to develop flavour.
Pour Bailey's in a tall glass and add the flavoured milk to it. Mix well using a fork.
Finish with grated chocolate on top.

name: Irish Coffee
instructions: Fill a tall glass (traditionally with a stem) with hot boiling water, leave to stand and then pour away the water.
Whip the cream until the bubbles disappear and it has just started to thicken and form ribbons underneath the whisk. Put back in the refrigerator.
Dissolve the sugar in 2 tablespoons of hot water in a small pan and bring to a boil. Add some freshly brewed rich coffee and stir. Then remove from heat and stir in the whisky.

Pour the mixture of whisky, sugar and coffee into the bottom of the pre-heated glass. Take the cold cream out of the fridge, whisk once again, then pour it on over the back of a spoon (to prevent it from sinking) until you hit the rim of the glass.
Grate a little nutmeg over the top and serve immediately.

name: Orange and Ginger Detox Drink
instructions: Juice the orange and carrot separately.
Pour the juice in a blender add turmeric and ginger.
Blend for 30 seconds and then squeeze half lemon.
Strain and serve.

name: Sol of Colaba
instructions: Infuse kokum in little hot water and extract juice.
Cool and add along with lime juice, sugar syrup, masala mix (1 gram or a pinch), vodka and ice cubes in a cocktail shaker and shake well.
Serve chilled in martini glass.​

name: Hibiscus Sherbet
instructions: Pour boiling water in a bowl of hibiscus.
Add boiling water in a bowl full of basil seeds.
Allow release of flavors.
Add bloomed basil seeds, sugar & rose water to the hibiscus water & mix well.
Pour the blend in a glass filled with ice cubes.
Serve cold.

name: Kiwi Margarita
instructions: Blend the ingredients together and serve in a salt rimmed Margarita glass

name: Orange Slushie
instructions: Blend together orange juice, chopped ginger, sugar, mint leaves & ice cubes.
Add orange slices and mint leaves to a glass.
Pour the slushie into the glass, serve.

name: Litchi Sorbet
instructions: Put the litchi in a pan with the water and sugar, and bring to a boil. Mix well, making sure the sugar has dissolved fully. Then allow it to cool.
When the compote has cooled, deseed the litchis and keep aside the syrup.

Mix the litchi flesh with the sugar syrup and blend in the lime juice. Chuck them into the food processor and blitz until everything is chopped and of even consistency. Then if you like, press everything through a sieve for extra smoothness.
Freeze the mixture until solid.
Once solid, smash up the sorbet and churn again for 5-10 minutes. Freeze overnight and then serve.
Note: You may if you like, add a dash of vodka, for an alcohol-laced sorbet.

name: Lychee and Dill Juice
instructions: Peel and deseed the lychees. Place them in a blender along with the remaining ingredients and blend for a few seconds.
Strain into a glass, top up with ice cubes and garnish with a sprig of dill.

name: Orange and Basil Juice
instructions: Peal the oranges and place them in the blender along with the other ingredients.
Blend for a few seconds and then strain into a glass. Garnish with a few basil leaves and serve.

name: Almond Milk Thandai
ingredients: 1/2  tsp of cardamom powder or 2-3 green cardamom (elaichi)
1 tsp roasted watermelon seeds or sunflower seeds
Seedless Dates/Raw Sugar/Palm Sugar to taste
instructions: Take all the ingredients in a grinder and grind really fine .
Note : For a larger batch of the spice mix, dry grind and keep in an airtight container, refrigerated for a few days. You can also alter the quantities to suit your personal taste and  preference.
Boil the milk with whichever sugar you are using and few strands of saffron (if using).
Add the ground powder and mix it well.Add more water if needed to get the desired consistency.
Strain the mixture to remove any particles to make a smooth Milk.
Cool and let it refrigerate for a minimum of one hour or even overnight to let the spices infuse in the drink.
Give it a mix before serving. Garnish and serve. If you have rose water or dried crushed rose petals, add some to taste.

name: Fresh Raw Badam Milk
ingredients: 1 cup organic raw almonds soaked for 8-12 hours
instructions: Place the raw almonds in a glass bowl or large jar, and cover with filtered water for 8 hours or more. Cover with lid.
Rinse the nuts several times to remove any of the anti-nutrients and enzyme inhibitors. If soaking for more than 8 hours, make sure you rinse and soak a few times.
Pour boiling water over the almonds and let them sit for five minutes. Drain. Skins should peel off easily.
Put almonds and water in a powerful blender and start blending at low speed. Blend them with less water for 1 - 2 minutes in the beginning, so they become a really smooth paste.
Add the remaining water. Blend everything together for another 2-3 minutes, until it is completely smooth and frothy.

Use a fine mesh strainer or place 3 or 4 layers of fine mesh cloth over a metal strainer set over a bowl,jar or jug. Pour small amounts of the almond milk through the strainer into the bowl. Use a spoon or spatula to press down on the strainer and move the solids around.
Once most of the milk has passed through the strainer, gather up the mesh cloth and gently squeeze it to remove excess liquid.
You'll be left with really fine almond meal inside the mesh cloth. You can discard it, or you can dry it out in a very low oven and use it in place of almond flour in baking recipes!

name: Sol Kadi (Konkani Kokum Drink)
ingredients: 2 cloves garlic or 1 tsp of ginger
instructions: Soak the kokum in about 3/4th cup water adding the heeng and salt. Keep aside for 3 - 4 hours.
Grind the grated coconut, garlic and chillies together with little water in a blender or mixer. When it grinds to a thick paste like texture, squeeze the 'milk' out of the paste and keep aside.
Add another 3/4th cup of water to the dry remains and run the mixer again for a minute or so. Again extract the milk - adding to the original extract.
Repeat this process two to three times till basically all the 'milk' gets extracted from the coconut .
NOTE :This process can be repeated a couple of times, but bear in mind that the milk gets thinner with every consecutive extraction.
Discard the kokum from the water, add the coconut milk mixture into the kokum water, mix well to get a creamy pink coloured solkadhi.
Taste it and adjust seasoning as required.
Keep aside for an hour or more .
NOTE: It is important to let the Solkadhi rest  for at least an hour before you consume it.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve chilled.
Chef's Tip : And remember to stir the Kadhi every time you serve it - the coconut extract tends to rise to the top when the kadhi is left untouched for a bit!

name: Old Fashioned
instructions: Muddle the orange peels, sugar and Angostura bitters together.
Then add 3-4 cubes of ice, Bourbon whiskey and drink up.

name: Moscow Mule
instructions: Pour vodka, lime juice, ginger lime cordial in a copper mug full of ice.
Top it off with half soda, half 7 up or sprite.
Stir and garnish with a cucumber stick and fresh mint.

name: Chilled Darjeeling First Flush with Mango & Mint
ingredients: 8 tsp of darjeeling first flush tea
1 lime for lime juice and zest
Mango (preferably ripe Alphonso mango, peeled and sliced)
instructions: Bring water to a boil, and then remove from fire to cool.
Then add the tea leaves to a large pot and allow to steep for 4-5 minutes.
Strain tea into a clean jug and keep in the deep freezer.
Add honey, lime juice and zest from 1 lime to the tea.
Add iced water (sans the ice) to the tea to make enough for 4 glasses and also to dilute the tea which would otherwise be very intensely flavoured.
Add mangoes and mint to the chilled tea and serve in tall glasses.

name: Mango and Peach White Iced Tea
instructions: Boil water in a large saucepan, and remove from heat.
Steep the white tea bags for about 7 minutes, then transfer tea to a large mixing bowl. Allow the tea to cool down for 30 minutes approximately.
Mix chopped peaches, mango, and 1 tbsp of honey (to taste) in a smaller mixing bowl.
Then transfer the fruits to a large pitcher, and pour the cooled tea into the pitcher.
Stir to combine, chill in the refrigerator and serve over ice.

name: Medusa
ingredients: 4 slices of fresh cucumber     90 ml of apple Juice
3 sprig of fennel            4 sprig of coriander leaves
instructions: Shake vodka, lime juice and apple juice.
The add cucumber, fennel and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
Serve chilled in a ceramic stone glass, if available.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Baileys Delight
instructions: Heat milk in a saucepan along with cinnamon and cardamons to develop flavour.
Pour Bailey's in a tall glass and add the flavoured milk to it. Mix well using a fork.
Finish with grated chocolate on top.

name: Love, Live and Laugh
instructions: Shake together vodka, espresso coffee and triple sec (sugar syrup).
Float cappuccino foam over it and sprinkle cinnamon powder over the foam.
Drop three coffee beans atop.

name: Express Affinity
instructions: In tall glass pour coffee espresso followed by coffee and top it up with cola.
Garnish it with coffee beans

name: Almond Saffron Milkshake
instructions: Grind the almonds walnuts and flax seeds together.
In a blender, mix the almonds, flaxs seeds, cold milk, honey and saffron.
Serve chilled.

name: Apple Chia Seeds Smoothie
instructions: Put all the ingredients in a blender and blend well.
Serve chilled.

name: Flax Seed Smoothie
ingredients: 1 cup chilled and roughly chopped strawberries
1/2 cup chilled and roughly chopped bananas
instructions: Add strawberries, bananas, flax seeds and honey in soya milk, blend in a juicer till the mixture is smooth and frothy.
Pour equal quantities of the smoothie into 2 individual glasses.
Serve garnished with a strawberry and banana slice.

name: Falsa Sherbet
instructions: Blend some washed falsa along with sugar, lemon juice & mint leaves in a blender.
Strain it.
Add  ice cubes, mint leaves & sliced lemon in a glass.
Pour falsa into it.
Serve cold.

name: Aam Panna with Vodka
instructions: Place mangoes in a pan along with water and bring to boil.
Drain off the water and peel, stone and pulp the mangoes with a spoon.
Place the pulp in a deep bowl.
Add water, sugar, salt and cumin.
Whisk thoroughly.
Transfer in a glass and add vodka.
Serve with ice cubes.

name: Avocado Lassi
instructions: Blend peeled & chopped avocado, yogurt & honey in a blender.
Serve.

name: Fruit Infused Tea
instructions: Brew together camomile tea bags, orange rind, berries, blueberries, mint leaves & ginger for four minutes.
Serve hot.

name: Xmas In A Glass
ingredients: 60 ml vodka15 ml ginger bread10 ml berry puree10 ml strawberry shrub10 ml lime juiceCrushed iceGarnish: mint sprig and caster sugar
instructions: Add all ingredients in a cocktails shaker. Shake it well with ice cubes, then strain it over crushed ice.
Garnish with mint sprigs and caster sugar.

name: Ek Bar Mulled Wine
ingredients: 100g sugar4 star anise2 cinnamon stick8 cloves1 nutmeg150 ml water1 lemon2 orange slices150 ml Cointreau750ml / 1 bottle light red wineTwist of orange zest and a star anise, to serve
instructions: Put sugar in a pan with star anise, cinnamon stick, cloves and 150ml water. Bring slowly to the boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar.

Simmer for 2 minutess, then pour into a large jug and leave to cool. Add 1 lemon and 2 orange, both thinly sliced, to the jug along with 150ml Cointreau and a 750ml bottle light red wine. Stir well, then cover and chill for at least 2 hours or overnight if you can.

Serve chilled or over ice, with a twist of orange zest and a star anise. If you'd like to serve a traditional warm mulled wine, there's no need to chill - simply warm through without boiling and serve in heatproof glasses.

name: Coconut Water With Lemon and Mint (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Break a coconut & empty water in a jug.
Scrape off coconut meat using a spoon,
Chop it finely and add it to coconut water.
Add mint, honey and lemon juice as well as lemon.
Mix and stir well, serve.

name: Hot White Chocolate (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Boil together milk, coconut milk & white chocolate in a container.
Add 1 vanilla pod.
Serve hot.

name: Pannakam (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Take jaggery in a bowl
Add water and allow it to melt.
Add chopped basil leaves, ginger, sliced mandarins, lemon juice and lemons to it.
Add cardamom powder & salt to taste.
Serve cold.

name: Chamomile, Apple & Mint Iced Tea (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Brew together tea bags, mint leaves, jasmine and lemon.
In a glass add ice, lemon, apple juice and brewed tea.
Serve cold.

name: Watermelon, Mint, Lime & Ginger Slushie (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Remove watermelon seeds
Cut it into dices,
Grind together mint leaves, chopped ginger, sugar, crushed ice & diced watermelon in a juicer.
Serve.

name: Mud Slide
instructions: Add all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker along with some ice cubes.
Shake well and fill up in an old fashioned glass.
You can also top it with some whipped cream and chocolate sauce or shavings.

name: Moorish
instructions: Take a large/over-sized Margarita coupe and fill it up with crushed ice.
Pour out the Bailey's Irish cream into a shot glass.
Similarly pour out the Kahlua into a shot glass.
Finally press out a shot of Espresso in a separate shot glass.
Serve the three shot glasses along with the Margarita coupe with crushed ice in it.
Pour all three into the glass and finish with chocolate cigar and gold specs.

name: Espresso Kahlua Martini
instructions:
Shake
 all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker along with a few ice cubes.

Pour into a chilled martini glass and garnish with 3 coffee beans on 
top.

name: Unfinished Business
instructions: Stir all the ingredients in a mixing glass.
Place an ice ball in a martini glass or champagne saucer.
Pour the drink over the ice ball and serve in smoked wooden chamber box.

name: White Russian
instructions: Fill up a fashioned glass with ice cubes.
Pour in the Kahlua, followed by vodka and top it off with cream.
Stir a little and serve.

name: Genie in a Bottle
ingredients: 30 ml of white rum  50 gm blueberries
instructions: Put all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker.
Fill it with ice and shake it well.
Strain into a glass.
Top up with soda.
Garnish with blueberry.

name: Cool as a Cucumber
instructions: Muddle the cucumber.
Put all the ingredients in cocktail shaker.
Fill with ice and shake it well.
Double strain in glass.
Garnish with mint sprig.

name: Pina Colada
ingredients: pineapple, orange and maraschino cherry for garnishing
instructions: Put all the ingredients in a blender
Blend it well
Serve in tabu tikki glass with ice cubes (5-6)
Garnish with fresh pineapple, orange and maraschino cherry

name: Earl-Y-Gin
instructions: Add gin, sweet & sour mix and tea to the cocktail shaker
Shake it well
Pour the drink in decanter
Put the ice cubes in the wooden glass
Pour the drink while serving
Garnish with cranberry sauce
Serve with Monaco cracker

name: Virgin Cucumber Cooler
ingredients: A sprig of mint or basil for garnish
instructions: Mix all the ingredients ​in a shaker.
Pour into a glass and top it up with soda.
Add mint or basil for garnish

name: Eternity
instructions: The process is simple. Make the tea liquor, and make sure it's not too strong.
Once the tea is cooled, take all the ingredients, muddle them well together and double strain it.
Serve chilled.

name: Gondhoraj Julep
instructions: Cut the lime into small wedges.
In a glass muddle the wedges along with mint leaves, sugar and salt and top it up with lemonade and ice.
Stir, and serve.

name: Grape Nectar
ingredients: A bunch of fresh black grapes (to yield about 120ml of juice)
instructions: Muddle the lychees along with the lemon chunks.
Make about 120 ml of juice with the black grapes, but don't throw away the pulp.
In an old fashioned glass, add the muddled fruits, and sugar syrup and crushed ice.
You can use a shaker to mix them well. Top it up with the fresh grape juice.

name: Homemade Ginger Ale
instructions: To make the mint juice, take mint leaves and ice and blend the two. Strain out the juice.
To make ginger juice, use ginger and a little bit of water and blend it
Mix mint juice, ginger juice, lemon juice, and the sugar syrup in a tall glass.
Top it up with Sprite or 7Up. Garnish with a spring of mint.
Serve chilled.

name: Very Berry Khatta
instructions: Muddle two of the mulberries, half of lime and one orange wedge. Add the grape juice, kala khatta syrup, Black salt to taste and stir.
Serve over crushed ice
Garnish with pomegranate, the remaining mulberries, and lime rings.

name: Indian Summer (Mango Cocktail)
instructions: Add the vodka, fresh mangoes, mint leaves, ginger, lime juice, sweet and sour along with a few ice cubes in a blender. Blend until well combined.
Pour it in a margarita glass and serve frozen garnished with a mint sprig.

name: Utterly Simple
ingredients: 200 ml hot apple juice          Garnish: Cinnamon, sugar rim, slice of apple
instructions: Rim glass with cinnamon sugar.
Put rum in the glass.
Break and add the cinnamon stick.
Top it up with steaming apple juice.
Float the apple slice.

name: Pineapple And Bell Pepper Margarita
ingredients: 6 pieces of bell peppers (red, green, yellow)
Garnish: One each strips of red, yellow and green bell peppers
instructions: Rim half the glass with salt.
Add all the bell peppers and pineapples in the shaker and muddle.
Fill the can half with ice cube. Pour tequila, lime juice, sugar syrup, PJ and shake well.
Taste to adjust and double strain or pour on the rocks into salt-rimmed glass.
Garnish with stripes of red, yellow and green bell peppers.

name: Classic Sangria
ingredients: Cut fruits (apples, orange, mint & fruits in season)
instructions: Add the cut fruits in the glass.
Pour in the red wine, orange wine, ice & top with 7Up/Sprite.
Garnish with fresh mint.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Fruity Daiquiris
ingredients: 45ml  Manama crushes - strawberry, peach, apricot, litchi
instructions: Rim the glass half with sugar.
Take a mixing tin filled half with crushed ice.
Add white rum, lime juice, sugar syrup or flavored crushes and blend it until it becomes slushy.
Serve and garnish with a sprig of mint or any fruit.

name: Twisted Whiskey Sour
instructions: Fill 3/4 the shaker with cube ice.
Add all ingredients and shake.
Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with half slice of orange.
Drizzle a few drops of Angostura bitter (optional).

name: Bloody Mary
ingredients: Garnish: green chilly and salt rim
instructions: Take a tall glass, rim it with salt.
Fill 3/4 glass with ice cubes.
Add tomato juice, Wooster sauce, Tabasco sauce, lime juice, squeeze a wedge of lime in it.
Stir and taste to adjust flavours - should be sharper and spicier than you want.
Slide in the vodka and stir.
Place a long green chilly in the glass.

name: Cosmopolitan
ingredients: Garnish: Half a slice orange/sparked orange peel.
instructions: Fill the shaker 3/4 with ice.
Add all the ingredients, squeeze both wedges of lime and drop in.
Shake it and strain into a martini glass.
Take a small peel of orange, flame it to extract the oil essence, drop it in the drink.

name: Classic Margarita
ingredients: Garnish: Half a slice of orange
instructions: Rim the glass with salt.
Fill the mixing tin 3/4 with ice cubes.
Pour tequila, Cointreau, lime wedge and lime juice, shake.
Strain it in the rimmed glass and Garnish.

name: Classic Mojito
instructions: Squeeze and drop lime wedges into glass.
Tear the mint leaves over the lime. Muddle.
Fill glass with crushed ice. Add sugar syrup and white rum.
Add more crushed ice to fill.
Top with soda. Stir and taste to adjust.
Note: Add fresh mango cubes and top with Sprite/7up in place of sugar and soda.

name: Caipiroska
ingredients: Garnish: a sprig of mint leaves/ 1/2 slice sweet lime
instructions: Glass: Old Fashioned
Squeeze and drop lime wedges into glass.
Tear the mint leaves over the lime.
Muddle. Fill glass with crushed ice.
Add sugar syrup and Smirnoff. Stir and taste to adjust.
Top with more crushed ice. Garnish.

name: Smoked Infused Negroni
instructions: Put all the ingredients in a glass, and mix it well.
Strain it into a tea pot with dry ice.
Garnish beautifully with orange wedges

name: Spaghetti Shot
ingredients: Grapes cooked in red wine for garnish
instructions: Heat 500 ml of orange juice with 5 gm of agar as the mix is boiled.
Then add 90 ml of gin in it.
Mix it properly and fill in spaghetti mold and leave it for 5 minutes in cold water.
After that release it by the help of air pressure through a syringe then fill it in to a shot glass.
Pour 15 ml of red wine reduction and 15 ml of cointreau.
Serve with grapes  cooked in red wine over the top.

name: Watermelon Lychee Granita
instructions: Pit lychees and discard the seeds.
In a blender, put mint leaves, ginger and sugar. Pulse once to release flavours.
Now add 1/2 cup of cubed watermelon, lemon juice and lychee.
Blend to a smooth puree and transfer to a bowl.
Blend the remaining watermelon to a smooth puree and combine this with the previous mixture, mix well.
Pour this mixture into a sturdy freezer-safe container. Freeze till set.
Once frozen, use a fork and start raking the mixture from the sides first. Proceed to the center eventually.
Put it back in the freezer once the entire mass is raked up.
After 2 hours, remove and repeat the raking process. Freeze till ready to serve.
Garnish with a few mint leaves.

name: Jal Jeera
ingredients: 1/2 Tbsp roasted and powdered cumin seeds
100 gm tamarind-soaked in warm water for half an hour at least
instructions: For sonth ki chutney:
Strain the tamarind through a strainer, adding water, to facilitate this.
Add enough water to make it into a pouring consistency.

Mix
 in the rest of the ingredients and bring to a boil, lower the heat, and
 let it simmer, stirring occasionally, till it thickens a bit.
For the water:
Mix all the ingredients together, chill and serve.

name: Gimlet
instructions: Pour gin and lime cordial into a shaker with ice.
shake well and pour the mixture out into a chilled glass.
Garnish with a lemon wedge to serve.

name: Aam Ras
instructions: Mix all the ingredients and add enough sugar and water to get the desired sweetness and consistency.
Chill it and serve garnished with mint leaves.

name: Gin Fizz
instructions: Mix together gin, lemon juice, sugar syrup with ice, shake well.
Strain into a glass topped with ice and soda water.

name: Jaswant Sherbat
instructions: Dissolve the sugar in the water, not letting it come to a boil.
When sugar is dissolved, increase the heat and bring to a boil.
Add the milk and continue to cook till scum forms on the sides, which you should skim off.
Add the lemon juice and continue to cook till one thread consistency is reached.
Turn off the heat and add the flowers, and cover immediately.
Leave it overnight.
Strain and store in bottles.

name: Rum Punch
ingredients: 2 dashes of Angostura Bitters soda water
instructions:
Shake with ice and pour entire contents into a tall 
glass.
Top with soda.
Garnish with a slice of pineapple and a cherry.

name: Ginger Fizz
ingredients: 1/2 tsp coriander seeds and soda to dilute ice-cubes
instructions: Combine ginger with lime juice in a jar. Seal with lid and place in sunshine for 2 days.
Strain through muslin.
Dissolve sugar in water with spices.  Boil for five minutes.
Cool and strain.
Place 1 Tbsp ginger juice in glass.
Sweeten with spiced syrup.  Top up with soda and ice-cubes.

name: Mango Squash
ingredients: Mango juice (mango pulp, strained through a fine sieve)
instructions: Method- 1
Add together sugar, lemon juice and mango juice in a pan.
Cover the pan and place it under the sun for a few days.
Ensure giving it a stir at least 3-4 times a day.
When dissolved, store in clean bottles.   Method- 2
Add 4 cups sugar and 2 cups water in a pan.
Bring to a boil.
Make sure that the contents are dissolved completely.
Cook over high heat or till one-thread consistency is reached.
Take it off the heat and mix in the lemon and mango juice.
Store in sterilized air tight bottles.

Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.

Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Screwdriver
instructions: Fill glass with crushed ice and pour the vodka over it.
Now fill the glass with orange juice.
Garnish with mint leaves or any garnish of choice and serve.

name: Hot Fruit Punch
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a pan, except lemon juice and fruit.
Bring to a simmer.
Add lemon juice and fruit.
Serve immediately.

name: Orange Liquer
instructions: Wash the fruit well and wipe dry.

Prick with a needle in two places and 
place them in a clean jar.
Fill 1/4 of the jar with it.

Now cover with
 a thick layer of sugar and mix well.

Cover again with a layer of sugar 
and then fill the jar with vodka.
Keep for about 2 months.
Stir everyday till the sugar dissolves.
Drain through a thin cloth and store.

name: Aam Rass
ingredients: 1 cup cold milk and crushed ice
instructions: Peel and chop the mangoes and blend it in a food processor along with the sugar.
Strain the mixture.
Mix in the milk and pour into glasses filled upto 1/4 with crushed ice.
Note: In case you like it thinner, dilute it with milk, according to taste.

name: Guava Thandai
instructions: Pour the thandai mixture in a jar.
Add some milk and a full pack of real guava juice.
Put some ice cubes, give it a nice stir.
Serve chilled!
For thandai mixture

name: Ginger Litchi Lemonade
instructions: In a jar, put minced ginger, lemon juice and lychee juice.
Add some ice, salt to taste and blend it well.
Pour it in a jar. Add sliced grapes and chia seeds to it. Mix it well with spoon.
Finally garnish it with some mint leaves and serve chilled.

name: Chocolate Hazelnut Milkshake
ingredients: Some nuts like hazelnut or almonds- whatever available
instructions: Add cocoa powder, hazelnut paste, cream, a little milk and some ice cubes.
Blend all the ingredients together.
Pour the concoction in a glass. Garnish it with some chocolate shavings and few nicely sliced hazelnuts or almonds.

name: Strawberry & Guava Smoothie
instructions: Slice the strawberries (or add any fruit of your choice).
Add real pink guava juice, milk, honey and some ice cubes.
Blend all the ingredients together. Pour it in a glass and serve it chilled.

name: Ananas da Panna
instructions: Roast the fresh pineapple until it is well cooked on a gas or on a grill.
Peel it and cut into small size cubes.
Take out the juice of the pineapple.
Add all ingredients to it.
Squeeze-in the lemon.
Serve chilled garnished with roasted cumin and chopped mint.

name: Fresh Lime Soda
ingredients: A few mint leaves for garnish, optional
instructions: Blend the lemon juice, sugar and soda together, till the sugar dissolves.
Divide the ice into four glasses, pour the nimbu paani over it, and serve, garnish with the mint leaves.

name: Mint Lassi
instructions: Add curd in a container.
Add sugar and add dried mint and mix it well.
Add a few ice cubes.
And garnish with a little ground cumin and fresh mint leaves.

name: Watermelon Ice
ingredients: Crushed black rock salt to taste
instructions: Peel and deseed the watermelon.
Add rock salt, kewra and mint and blend completely.
Freeze until half frozen.
Pour into glasses and top with some pomegranate syrup.

name: Iced Mint and Lime Tea
instructions: Place teabag in a heatproof jug.

Pour over boiling water, mint leaves 
and lime rind.
Cover and allow it to sleep for 30 minutes.

Strain the 
liquid, chill well.
Then add lime juice, strips of mint to taste and serve over ice.

name: Apple Punch
instructions: Add apple juice in a container.
Then add few drops of lime juice into ti.
Put 2 cinnamon sticks, 1/2  ginger cube, some cloves and lemon strings. Combine the mixture well.
Chill and garnish it with few mint leaves.
Serve over ice.

name: Ginger Ale
instructions:
Dissolve the sugar in the water over low heat, increase the heat after sometime and 
bring it to boil after the sugar dissolves.

Cook, till the syrup 
thickens a little - about 1 thread.

Shut off the heat and add the ginger
 and lemon juice, mix well and store in an airtight sterilized bottle.

To serve, pour 3-4 Tbsp of syrup in a glass, add crushed ice and 
soda/water and mix well.

Garnish with the lemon slice and mint leaves 
and serve.

name: Lemon Squash
instructions: Fill a bottle with sugar and pour lemon juice to come up till the top.

Sun it for a few days, shaking the bottle 3-4 times a day, till totally 
dissolved. When dissolved, you use it.

Alternatively put 4 cups sugar 
and 3 cups water in a pan and dissolved sugar, by stirring over low 
heat.

When dissolved, bring to a boil and cook for about 5 minutes 
over high heat or till one-thread consistency is reached.

Take it 
off the heat and mix in 1-1/1/2 cups of lemon juice (according to 
taste), store in sterilized air tight bottles.

name: Iced Jaljeera
ingredients:
1 Tbsp grated
 ginger salt(gourmet flavoured salt) to taste
A pinch of chilli powder (kashmiri mirch)
instructions: For the jaljeera, add all the ingredients in a food processor and blend it together.
Chill overnight. Then strain and freeze it.
Garnish the drink with some boondis and serve.

name: Masalewali Chai
instructions:
Bring the water to a boil. Add the tea leaves and ginger 
and simmer for a minute.
Add the chai masala. For chai masala, grind equal quantities of star anise (badiyan), cinnamon (dal chini), laung (cloves) and elaichi (cardamom). (In this case, one or two of each)

Add the milk and sugar, let it come to a boil
 once more, and then strain it into the cups, and serve. This one is usually allowed to simmer for little longer.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.

Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Badaam ka Sharbat
ingredients:
8 green cardamoms -crushed, 
cooked in water and strained
1/8 tsp potassium meta bi-sulphite(potassium salt of bisulfate anion)
instructions:
Add a little water (enough to facilitate blending) to the almonds and 
blend to a fine paste.

Strain through a fine sieve or muslin cloth and
 add some more water to the left-over almonds and blend and strain 
again.
Make the liquid up-to 2 cups, by adding water if necessary.

Add 
sugar to the strained almond liquid and dissolve over low heat.

When it 
dissolves, increase the heat and bring to a boil and let the syrup cook.
Keep skimming off the scum as it cooks.

Cook till a drop of syrup 
pressed between two fingers, forms a thread (one-thread consistency).

Add the cardamom extract and the kewda essence. Strain through a 
muslin cloth and cool.

When cool, mix the potassium in a little of the
 syrup first and then add to the whole lot.

Store in clean airtight 
bottles.

name: Badaam Milk
instructions:
Place the almonds in a bowl and pour boiling water over. Leave for half 
an hour.

Peel the almonds and Chop half the almonds fine and place the other half in a 
blender.
Place the milk, condensed milk, elaichi powder and ice in the blender too.
Blend till well mixed and serve garnished with the chopped almonds.

name: Fruity Crush
ingredients: Pineapple crush or fresh pineapple puree

Note:
 For a sweet rim, cut a slice of pineapple and drench it in castor 
sugar.

Then turn a glass upside down and put the rim of the glass on the
 sugared pineapple slice so that the sugar sticks onto the rim of the 
glass.
instructions: Add lime juice in a container.
Then add pineapple puree or crush, sugar syrup and salt into a shaker.
Mixed the mixture properly.
Chill and serve over ice.

name: Cold Coffee
instructions: Take some espresso, crushed ice, condensed milk and 1 cup of regular milk.
Throw them all in a blender.
Blend it for a few minutes and served chilled.

name: Banana & Honey Smoothie
instructions: Peel the bananas. Put yogurt and bananas in a blender
Add 2 tsp of honey. Add 2 tsp of pumpkin seeds. Add a dash of water
Give it a good whisk till smooth.
Pour in a tall cold glass.
Garnish with pumpkin seeds and honey.

name: Smoked Melon Martini
instructions: Blend with crushed ice.
Double strain in a chilled martini glass

name: Beauty Drink Lemona
instructions: Blitz all the ingredients along with lots of crushed ice in a blender and serve chilled.

name: Irish Cream Liquer
ingredients: 14 oz sweetened condensed milk (400 ml approx)
1 2/3 cup Irish whiskey (Here Jameson's is used)
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender and set on high speed for 30 seconds.
Bottle in a tightly sealed container and refrigerate. Shake before using.
Will keep for up to 2 months.
Tip: Add mint essence and you have mint baileys.

name: Pomegranate Juice
ingredients: 2 cups pomegranate juice or amla juice (Indian gooseberry)
instructions: Take a sharp knife and carefully peel the rind from the aloe vera plant leaves and discard the rind. Peel the yellow layer just beneath the rind with a sharp knife and you should be left with approximately 2 Tbsp (30 ml) of clear aloe vera gel. (Clean the gel before adding to the juice.)
In a blender add pomegranate juice, chopped beetroot and blend.
Now add aloe vera gel. Give it a whiz.
Lastly add some black pepper.
Serve.
Note: For better taste and digestive properties, add a pinch of Lavan Bhaskar churan.

name: Radiant Lemonade
instructions: Mix all the ingredients in a blender.
Add little bit of water to adjust the consistency.
Sieve and serve.

name: Radiant Juice
instructions: Put all the fruits and ginger in a blender.
Add a dash of water to adjust the consistency and blend well.

name: Melon and Kiwi Fruit Smoothie
instructions: Mix all the ingredients in a blender and blend well.
Serve chilled.
You can use sugar/honey according to your taste.
Fell free to throw in any fruits that you like.

name: Honey-Lemon-Ginger Tea
ingredients: 1 tsp tea leaves, for every cup
instructions: In a pan heat 3 cups of water.
Before it begins to boil add ginger.
Just as it starts to boil add the tea leaves, lemon juice and honey.
Strain it into a cup and enjoy!

name: Strawberry Banana Smoothie
instructions: In a blender add milk, bananas, honey, a handful of strawberries.
Give this a good blend.
Garnish with a some mint leaves.

name: Carribean Passion
instructions: Fill up a martini glass with ice and keep aside.
Crush the basil leave in a can and muddle them.
Add the pine apple juice to it along with some a crushed lemon wedge.
Add the three rums to it.
Shake well.
Remove the ice from the glass and strain this mixture into it.

name: Chocolate Malt Milkshake
instructions: In a blender add milk, cookies, malt, ice cream and vanilla essence. Blend.
Pour in a glass and your chocolate milkshake is ready.

name: Hot Apple Punch
ingredients: 4 (500 gm) apples, medium    1 Tbsp ginger, coarsely chopped
instructions: Extract the apple juice along with the ginger.
Put the juice, dalchini, salt and black pepper in a pan and bring to a boil.
Simmer for 2-3 minutes to infuse the flavors.
Divide the pudina and julienne ginger into four cups, and strain the hot liquid over it.
Add a few drops of lemon juice and serve.

name: Beetroot Milkshake
ingredients: 2 beetroots, boiled with skin on, peeled and cut into chunks
instructions: In a blender puree the beetroot.
Add sugar syrup, milk, crushed ice and cinnamon powder. Blend.
Add vanilla ice cream and mix.
Serve chilled.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Beetroot And Berry Shots
instructions: Preheat the oven at 200 degree Celsius. Peel the beetroot and boil till tender, say 20 minutes.
Slice the beetroot. In a mixing bowl, add olive oil, balsamic, rosemary, salt and pepper.
Add the beetroot and mix it well so it is evenly coated.
Arrange on a baking tray and roast it for about 20 minutes or you could simply saute in a pan. Let it cool.
In a food processor add the beetroot and the berries and blend it well.
Add some water if need be. You want a consistency of a flowing cream.
Adjust the seasoning again, chill in the fridge.
Serve with a little sprinkling of chopped parsley.

name: Virgin Punch
instructions: Stir together all the ingredients in a large jug or bowl and add some ice cubes.

name: Ginger Zinger
ingredients: 1/2 tsp peeled and grated root ginger
A pinch of coarse black pepper
instructions: Mix all the ingredients together and then strain before serving with ice.
Tip: Use a stick of lemon grass as a stirrer cum garnish.

name: Mango Smoothie
instructions: This variation on the basic lassi recipe is made using a fruit that is synonymous with India.
In this recipe, ready-made mango pulp is used for extra sweetness, but a fresh-pulped large or medium mango can be substituted.
Blend the ingredients together and serve with ice.

name: Pear Granita
instructions: Place the pears with the lemon juice and brown sugar and blend in a mixer.
Remove the mixture from the blender and place in 2 glasses.
Whip the cream in a bowl and spread it over the pear mixture.
Serve chilled.
Tip: If you're placing the glasses in the refrigerator, make sure the granitas are covered.

name: Lemon Cheer
instructions: For the sugar syrup, mix the sugar in 1/2 a cup of water and bring to a boil.
Reduce the flame and cook till it reduces to a concentrate. Lightly pound the mint leaves to bring out the aroma.
Put them in a jug and pour in in the sugar syrup. Add the lime juice and water.
Shake well and serve chilled.

name: Zeta Colada
ingredients: Garnish: Coconut foam + roasted coconut + cocktail umbrellaGlass: Tall/hurricane
instructions: Add all ingredients into shaker with ice.
Shake and strain into glass.
Squirt the coconut foam.
Sprinkle with roasted coconut.

name: Yellow Scorpion
ingredients: Splash of lime juice and sugar syrup
instructions: Fill the martini glass with ice to chill it.
Put the aniseed into the mixing can. Muddle.
Add the pineapple. Muddle it again.
Half fill shaker with ice.
Add the vodka, pineapple juice, lime and sugar. Shake.
Double strain into the chilled martini glass.
Garnish with some freshly ground anise.

name: TLC (Tender Loving Care)
instructions: Blend all ingredients together with crushed ice till slushed.
Pour into glass.
Drizzle the chocolate sauce to decorate.

name: Thai Mai Shu
instructions: Create 2 chilli - apple spheres using 2.5ml measuring spoon.
Cook for 1/2 min and then rinse in water. Place in ceramic spoon.
Muddle ginger, chilli and lemongrass and syrup until paste turns red.
Add remaining gin, liqueurs and basil.
Shake and double strain in glass, and serve on a cocktail plate with spheres.

name: Strawberry Daiquiri
ingredients: 15 ml lime juiceGarnish: Half slice sweet lime, mint leaves
instructions: Fill shaker/pitcher with crushed ice.
Pour all ingredients over the ice. Blend to a slush.
Taste to adjust flavors.
Pour into glass. Garnish.

name: Singapore Sling
instructions: Add all ingredients into shaker with ice.
Shake and strain over fresh ice or pour with ice into glass.
Splash with soda and garnish.

name: Shamrock
instructions: Chill the glass and rim it with some sugar and mint liqueur.
Put some ice in a shaker and pour in all the ingredients except the whiskey.
Shake it well. Fill the glass with ice cubes and pour in the drink.
Pour the whiskey on top. Garnish and serve.

name: Sgroppino
ingredients: Garnish: Julienne of Italian lemon rind and almond flakes
instructions: Put the scoops of ice cream in a glass bowl or mixing glass.
Soften the ice creams with a spoon & fork.
Add the sparkling wine and gently whisk till the ice cream is creamy.
Stir in the vodka. Pour creamy mixture into martini glass.
Garnish with lemon rind juliennes and almond flakes.

name: Pure Sin
ingredients: Garnish: Chocolate stick & a sprig of mint
instructions: Put 1 scoop of crushed ice in a blender.
Add all the ingredients and blend till smooth.
Pour it into the glass. Garnish & serve.

name: Pimms Cup
instructions: Fill a jug with ice. Pour in the Pimm's generously.
Top with ginger ale and lemonade.
Add fresh fruit(orange, lemon, strawberries, cucumber) and mint leaves.
Stir.

name: Oriental Cooler
instructions: Put the lemongrass in the mixing can. Muddle.
Add ice cubes. Pour the raspberry vodka.
Add a dash of sugar syrup and the cranberry juice.
Shake.
Fill glass with ice cubes.
Double strain the mixture on the ice.
Add a some more ice. Take a lemongrass stick and put it in the drink.
Garnish it with a basil leaf. Serve.

name: Negroni
instructions: Fill glass with ice cubes. Pour all ingredients over ice.
Stir. Drop the orange wedge into drink

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Mai Tai
ingredients: 15 ml almond syrup or almond liqueur
Garnish: 2 cherries, pineapple wedge, pineapple leaf, mint leaves
instructions: Add crushed ice to shaker. Pour all ingredients over ice.
Squeeze and drop the lime wedges in. Shake for 10 seconds.
Taste to adjust flavors. Fill glass with crushed ice.
Pour drink over ice. Garnish.

name: Island Affair
ingredients: Soda/ sprite to topGarnish: Half slice sweet lime, mint leaves
instructions: Fill shaker with ice.
Squeeze wedge of lime and drop in.
Add white rum, coconut liqueur, litchi crush and shake.
Pour into glass. Add blue curacao. Top with 1/2 soda, 1/2 sprite.
Float dark rum over the ice. Garnish!

name: Blonde Sangria
instructions: Fill the jug with ice.
Add the citrus vodka.
Put in the chopped fruits.
Pour the wine. Top with apple soda.
Garnish with mint.
Stir!

name: Melon Saketini
instructions: Add all ingredients into shaker with ice.
Shake and strain into glass.
Garnish.

name: Mediterranean Martini
ingredients: 30 ml Polish rye vodka/ French grape vodka
instructions: Add strawberries, gooseberries and mint leaves in mixing glass.
Muddle to release juices.
Fill mixing glass with ice.
Add vodka, lime & sugar.
Shake and strain into martini glass.
Top with sparkling wine.
Garnish.

name: Litchi Shochutini
ingredients: Splash of lychee syrup/juiceGarnish: Whole lychee
instructions: Add all ingredients into shaker with ice.
Taste to adjust flavor.
Shake and strain into glass.
Garnish.

name: Liquid Fruit Salad
instructions: Put lychees, peach, mango and the mint in the glass.
Muddle all of it.
Put some crushed ice.
Pour the lychee juice, a dash of lime juice.
Add the vodka. Stir.
Top with some more crushed ice. Serve!

name: Espresso Martini
ingredients: 10 ml hazelnut syrupGarnish: 2 mint ringsGlass: Martini
instructions: Fill martini glass with ice and keep to chill.
Fill shaker with ice.
Pour all the ingredients over the ice.
Shake and strain into chilled glass.
Sit the mints on a stick over the rim.

name: Cuban Martini
ingredients: 30 ml Polish rye vodka/ French grape vodka
instructions: Fill mixing glass with ice.
Pour in vodka, triple sec, lime & sugar.
Add fresh mint.
Shake & strain into martini glass.
Top with sparkling wine.
Splash in the cranberry juice.
Twist the orange peel and drop into drink.

name: Classic Dry Martini
ingredients: A breeze of scotchGarnish: 3 dry vermouth soaked olives on a cocktail stickGlass: Martini
instructions: Fill martini glass with ice and keep to chill.
Add plenty of ice in the cocktail shaker and pour in the chilled vodka.
Dip a stirrer into a bottle of scotch and stir the vodka and ice with the scotch lined stirrer.
Strain into the chilled glass.
Stick in the olive stick.

name: Chocolate Martini
instructions: Grease the glass with chocolate.
Put ice in the mixer.
Pour the creme liqueur, vodka on the ice.
Shake it.
Pour it into the glass.
Stick in the chocolate cigar.
Serve!

name: Cherry Martini
instructions: Put ice in the mixer.
Pour a shot of gin on the ice.
Pour a capful of martini.
Pour a shot of manachino cherry liqueur.
Pour a shot glass of cherry juice.
Shake it.
Pour into the glass.
Garnish it with cherries.

name: Bellini
ingredients: 30/45 ml fresh peach puree (preferably white Italian peaches)
Cold sparkling wine (preferably Italian Prosecco) to top
instructions: Put peach puree in glass.
Fill with cold sparkling wine.
Stir.

name: Kurumba Sunset
instructions: Muddle the lime wedges, orange slices & mint leaves.
Fill glass with crushed ice and pour other ingredients.
Stir, taste, adjust, top with more ice if requires.
Garnish.

name: Kurumba Passion
ingredients: Garnish: Slice of dragon fruitGlass: Hurricane/Tall
instructions: Pour cranberry and grenadine, then, fill glass with ice.
Pour all ingredients over ice in a shaker.
Shake and strain into the glass.
Float the dark rum.
Garnish.

name: Kurumba Fire
instructions: Fill shaker with ice.
Pour in all ingredients.
Shake and strain into martini glass.
Garnish.

name: High On Grass
instructions: Put all ingredients into blender over ice.
Blend till smooth and slushed.
Pour into glass.

name: Hemmingway Air
ingredients: Garnish: Pink grapefruit foam and cherry
instructions: Add all ingredients into shaker with ice.
Shake and strain into glass.
Squirt the grapefruit foam over drink.
Garnish.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).
